page.title: 01GAZETEER
page.content: {Haxby}is 4 miles North of York, covers 2206 acres and has a population of 8865 (1981). By 1086 St.Peters Minster York had settled seven farmers on their Haxby estate. Now, in 1985, Haxby is a village which has many modern buildings, a public library, two shopping arcades ,three modern primary schools and large estates of new housing. { Huntington}is 2 miles North of York covers 1850 acres and has a population of 8888 (1981), however this survey block only covers old Huntingon village with approximately half the total population. { Towthorpe}is 4 miles North of York, covers 1075 acres and has a population of 1430 (1983). The remainder of the survey area is mainly covered by farmland.
